Posts.Content: I really do have an open mind. I'm not ruling out anything. I'm also looking for any real people who have done Brachytherapy around my age to hear their story. Originally Posted by tpjames iicec, thanks for posting and sharing. Indeed thats a lot of positive spots. Even at G6. For my worries the %'s are very high which is an indicator of future concerns. At your young age, it is really best to go over the treatments that best fit you and your family's concerns with your urologist/oncologist . We can each share what was good for us but at the end of the day, although we may have similar circumstances, we are each very different and will respond to treatments differently. I have posted my post surgery experiences threads ( 7 days now ) ( tpjames ) for others to review and maybe gain some information. My recovery is going well and progress is tracking as expected and similar to others. I have learned tons from others before me and it has really helped me personally pre surgery as well as post surgery. Under your forum "settings" , edit your signature to include your stats, as this is helpful for others to offer insight as well. stay positive , as awful as it seems , the good news is you know what you have to deal with and that beats not knowing any day of the week. best to you t
Posts.Title: Not sure what treatment any help?

Posts.Content: I'm 51 stage 2 Gleason score 6. I'm looking long term quality of life. I feel surgery will cause other problems. It feels like Brachytherapy to me is best. Any thoughts? I want to be active.
Posts.Title: Not sure what treatment any help?

Posts.Content: I will get more info later today. 12 samples during biopsy. 8 positive. 1 @ 30%. 6 @ 70% and 1 @ 90%.
